title: Total Recall, or: That Time We Disabled Ranked

I imagined this as a bunch of people sitting in a round table like in those american government movies. When they disabled ranked they pressed a big red button.

Also, this is proof that Riot cares about their playerbase :P

All I can see, to be honest, is "We coded our game so that a command that cancels all previous commands and set the champion to an idle state for 8 seconds was completely undermined by what was going on prior to hitting the b button."

Except, recall *doesn't* cancel all previous commands, as the article just pointed out...

My guess is that this was potentially some type of cast-animation cancelling. If recall was implemented as "just another skill" (i.e., with a cast time, and an effect that plays once it's done), and Riot introduced some mechanism or effect that suddenly forced all previous or current animations/casts to complete, it might cause a problem such as this.

Even worse, there would be nothing obvious to the developer writing code that they're about to affect the recall action, unless they knew exactly how the recall action was implemented (and on a code-base as large as Riot likely has, that's a very small chance indeed).

To be brutally honest, the reason all you can see is an apparently obvious bug is because you've never done any large-scale software engineering {{champion:112}}
Perhaps, but at the same time I don't have millions upon millions of dollars in budget and literally thousands of people willing to code and test the game.
